info.name: Word Heist
info.attribution:
Tile design and room layout by LawDawg96.  Released to the public domain under CC0.

Wood grain background by RyanPro available under the Pixabay license from https://pixabay.com/photos/trees-wood-yellow-wood-oak-1915247/

Tile bag by mousewax available as CC0.

Recenter icon is a Google Material Symbol and is in the public domain. Available at https://fonts.gstatic.com/s/i/short-term/release/materialsymbolsoutlined/recenter/wght200/24px.svg
info.description: Play letter tiles to form words. Change words by stacking tiles. Earn points by stealing words from other players and having the highest tile in a word at the end of the game.
info.similarDesigner: Kyle Miller, Ellios Rudell, Rudell Design
info.helpText:
Players take seats and press the reset button in the upper right. A random player will be chosen to start and 5 tiles are dealt to each player.

Move tiles from hand to play on the board. To swap tiles, move them to the small holder just above the hand and press the adjacent recycle button. Note that the tile bag is shuffled every time a tile is added to the bag.

To refill hand to 5 tiles, press the black hand surrounded by dashed black lines button. To end your turn, press the skip/next button in the lower right.

The color and number of the pile handle indicate the number of stacked tiles. White = 2, light gray = 3, gray = 4, black = 5.

To bank a tile after stealing a word, drag it from the tile bag to the small holder above the seat.

The board moves by clicking and dragging an area that is not a tile or button.  Click the recenter button in the upper right to return the board to its starting position.

At end of game, add up banked tiles plus words owned by player with the highest tile in the word.  Use + and - score buttons to calculate score.
